m1.Name: Combat Knife
m1.Description: Reliable and balanced; standard issue for soldiers and scouts.

m1.Name: Switchblade
m1.Description: Fast to draw and easy to conceal.

m1.Name: Trench Spike
m1.Description: Narrow and brutal; built for piercing through armor and cloth alike.

m1.Name: Straight Razor
m1.Description: A gentleman’s hidden threat — clean, quick, silent.

m1.Name: Wrench
m1.Description: A worker’s weapon; short, heavy, and efficient.

m1.Name: Sap / Blackjack
m1.Description: Nonlethal; on a hit, target suffers –1 Accuracy until next turn.

m1.Name: Folding Baton
m1.Description: Compact and responsive; favored by officers and agents.

m1.Name: Serrated knife
m1.Description: Lethal and vicious; on hit, apply 1 Bleed for 1 turn.

m2.Name: Trench Club
m2.Description: Weighted to break bone and resolve alike.

m2.Name: Bayonet (Detached)
m2.Description: A soldier’s last resort — short, sharp, and unrelenting.

m2.Name: Machete
m2.Description: Broad-bladed and heavy; cuts through brush and bodies alike.

m2.Name: Hatchet
m2.Description: Compact chopping weapon, favored by laborers and soldiers.

m2.Name: Crowbar
m2.Description: Built for leverage, swung for survival.

m2.Name: Cane Sword
m2.Description: Elegant concealment; gains +1 Accuracy on surprise attacks.

m2.Name: Police Baton
m2.Description: Balanced for control; may disarm on a successful hit.

m2.Name: Field Shovel
m2.Description: A sharpened field shovel; quick, brutal, and efficient.

m2.Name: Baseball Bat
m2.Description: Weighted for consistent impact — clean and punishing.

m3.Name: Fire Axe
m3.Description: Built to breach walls — or anything else that resists.

m3.Name: Sledgehammer
m3.Description: Slow but devastating; requires full focus to swing.

m3.Name: Pipe Wrench (Large)
m3.Description: Industrial tool turned weapon; reduces target’s Armor by 1 until next turn.

m3.Name: Baseball Bat (Reinforced)
m3.Description: Weighted for consistent impact — clean and punishing. -1 Accuracy

m3.Name: Pickaxe
m3.Description: Drives straight through cover; ignores 1 Defense.

m3.Name: Barbed Club
m3.Description: Crude, jagged, and cruel; on hit, apply 1 Bleed.

m3.Name: Rifle Stock / Buttstock
m3.Description: Improvised and sturdy; stuns on a critical hit.

m3.Name: Industrial Cleaver
m3.Description: Oversized and heavy; not elegant, but final.

r1.Name: Light Bow
r1.Description: Compact, quiet weapon ideal for stealth and precision.

r1.Name: Light Crossbow
r1.Description: Accurate and silent; reloads every turn after firing.

r1.Name: Throwing Knife
r1.Description: Quick and retrievable; gains +1 Accuracy at short range (≤2 tiles).

r1.Name: Molotov
r1.Description: Ignites a 1-tile area for 1 turn; affected creatures take 1 fire damage.

r1.Name: Compound Bow
r1.Description: Mechanically-assisted; precise and silent, +1 Accuracy at max range.

r2.Name: Hunting Bow (Heavy)
r2.Description: Long draw and excellent reach; delay attack for +1 Accuracy.

r2.Name: Medium Crossbow (Heavy)
r2.Description: Punches through armor; ignores 1 Armor, reloads every turn.

r2.Name: Heavy Crossbow
r2.Description: Massive bolt impact; ignores 2 Armor and can pin small targets.

r2.Name: Grenade
r2.Description: Explodes in a 1-tile radius; deals full damage to all within.

f1.Name: Pocket Pistol
f1.Description: Small, concealable sidearm with limited range and power.

f1.Name: Service Pistol
f1.Description: Reliable standard-issue firearm; well-balanced in speed and precision.

f1.Name: Revolver
f1.Description: Durable and steady; fires slower but rarely jams.

f1.Name: Automatic Pistol
f1.Description: Capable of controlled bursts; may fire twice per turn (each for –1 damage).

f1.Name: Sawed-Off Shotgun
f1.Description: Wide scatter at close range; enemies within 1 tile take +1 damage.

f2.Name: Carbine Rifle
f2.Description: Reliable infantry weapon with balanced accuracy and rate of fire.

f2.Name: Bolt-Action Rifle
f2.Description: High stopping power; must cycle between shots.

f2.Name: Sniper Rifle
f2.Description: Extremely accurate; when aiming for a full turn, deals +1 damage.

f2.Name: Automatic Rifle
f2.Description: Suppressive bursts; all enemies in a 3-tile cone take –1 Accuracy until next turn.

f2.Name: Machine Gun (Mounted / Bipod)
f2.Description: Sustained fire weapon; can’t move and shoot. Hits up to 3 adjacent tiles.

f2.Name: Combat Shotgun
f2.Description: Wide spread; may target up to 2 adjacent enemies (each for –1 damage).

f2.Name: Rocket Tube (Prototype)
f2.Description: Experimental launcher; 2-tile radius, dangerous to user if fired in close range.

a1.Name: Leather Jacket
a1.Description: Common protective wear; light resistance without hindering movement.

a1.Name: Padded Vest
a1.Description: Absorbs minor impacts and blunt trauma; easy to wear beneath uniforms.

a1.Name: Trenchcoat (Reinforced)
a1.Description: Weighted lining and stitched plating; discreet but sturdy.

a1.Name: Worker’s Overalls
a1.Description: Rugged material provides minor resistance to heat and sparks.

a1.Name: Flight Suit
a1.Description: Protects against friction, wind, and heat; designed for cockpit survival.

a1.Name: Motor Jacket (Armored)
a1.Description: Steel-backed leather favored by couriers, drivers, and messengers.

a2.Name: Ballistic Vest
a2.Description: Layered steel plates; reliable against low-caliber rounds.

a2.Name: Combat Webbing
a2.Description: Balanced rigging and padding; worn by soldiers and mercenaries.

a2.Name: Police Riot Gear
a2.Description: Designed for blunt and shrapnel resistance; noisy and bulky.

a2.Name: Field Jacket (Lined)
a2.Description: Rugged and padded; offers balanced protection and comfort.

a2.Name: Engineer’s Suit
a2.Description: Built for high-heat environments and machinery exposure.

a3.Name: Infantry Armor (Plated)
a3.Description: Standard-issue reinforced chestplate; reliable but cumbersome.

a3.Name: Bomb Disposal Suit
a3.Description: Heavy armor specialized for explosive protection; limits awareness.

a3.Name: Prototype Combat Suit
a3.Description: Early combat exosuit; powered servos offset weight but restrict finesse.

a3.Name: Industrial Exosuit
a3.Description: Built for lifting and mining; extreme protection, low grace.

a3.Name: Trench Armor
a3.Description: Old but durable; heavy plates and canvas straps still hold strong.

ss.Name: Police Riot Shield
ss.Description: Standard police-grade protection; reliable cover at the cost of mobility.

ss.Name: Improvised Shield
ss.Description: Any sturdy scrap — metal door, bin lid, or panel; breaks after 3 hits.

ss.Name: Infantry Buckler
ss.Description: Small, maneuverable shield for parrying and redirection.

ss.Name: Ballistic Shield
ss.Description: Full-coverage shield; absorbs gunfire but limits aim and mobility.
